item.title: Kali Linux ARP Spoofing
item.description: In computer networking, ARP spoofing, ARP cache poisoning, or ARP poison routing, is a technique by which an attacker sends (spoofed) Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) messages onto a local area network. ARP The Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) is a communication protocol used for discovering the link layer address, such as a MAC address, associated with a given internet layer address, typically an IPv4 address. Check ARP on Linux/Mac/Win. arp -a Find Default Gateway Check your default gateway:
